body.p: Insurance contracts create rights and obligations that work together to generate cash inflows and cash outflows. Some insurance contracts may:

li.p: contain embedded derivatives that, if bifurcated, would be within the scope of IFRS 9;
contain investment components that, if they were provided under separate contracts, would be within the scope of IFRS 9; or
provide goods and non-insurance services that, if they were provided under separate contracts, would be within the scope of IFRS 15.
